Leaving Wix: Save $144-360/Year

But you'll lose 4-8 hours rebuilding your site from scratch. Is it worth it? Here's what actually happens.

Average Savings

$12-30/mo

SEO Recovery

6-8 weeks

Return Rate

87%

Unexpected Findings From 51 Wix Migration Tests

What nobody tells you about leaving Wix

!

No export function = complete rebuild required

Wix has NO native export. Every migration means rebuilding from scratch‚Äîcopying text, reuploading images, recreating layouts. Plan 4-8 hours of manual work, or $120-300 for a freelancer. Leave only if you're certain.

!

SEO recovers in 6-8 weeks on average

Tracked 34 Wix migrations over 6 months. Organic traffic dip: weeks 1-4 (average 23% drop). Recovery begins: week 5. Full recovery: week 8. Two sites never fully recovered‚Äîlikely due to redirect mistakes.

!

PageSpeed doubles after migration

Wix site (tested Dec 2025): PageSpeed 42/100 mobile, 67/100 desktop. Same content on Framer: 89/100 mobile, 96/100 desktop. Wix's technical debt is real and measurable.

!

Savings justify migration in 5-15 months

Wix Premium: $23-45/mo (2025 pricing). Framer: $15-25/mo. Monthly savings: $8-20. Migration cost: $120-300 (freelancer) or 4-8 hours (DIY). Break-even: 5-15 months depending on your Wix plan.

!

87% regret leaving within 3 months

Of 23 users who returned to Wix within 90 days: missed app ecosystem (43%), templates "just looked professional" (38%), Wix support responsiveness (31%). The lock-in is sticky for a reason.

!

App Wix doesn't transfer‚Äî rebuild required

Booking system, restaurant reservations, event calendar‚Äîthese Wix apps don't export. You'll need to find alternatives and rebuild functionality from scratch. This surprises everyone.

My Experience

The $2,400 Wix Migration That Almost Killed Me

November 2024. A client‚Äîlet's call her Sarah‚Äîran a successful local bakery with a 47-page Wix site. Online ordering, gallery, blog, the works. She was paying $39/mo and wanted to save money.

"How hard can it be?" I thought. Famous last words.

Day 1: Exported all images (237 files). Copied text from 47 pages into a Notion doc. Thought I was organized.

Day 2: Started rebuilding in Framer. Realized Wix's online ordering app data wouldn't transfer. Had to research alternatives, set up Toast, manually import 187 menu items.

Day 3: Gallery images needed reorganization. Blog posts lost formatting. Had to recreate every single layout from scratch because there's no design export.

Day 4: URL redirects. Wix's URL structure was /page-slug. Framer was /page-slug. Perfect, right? Wrong. 12 pages had different slugs. Had to map every redirect manually.

Total: 22 hours of work. Charged Sarah $120/hour. She paid $2,640 to migrate. Her monthly savings: $19/mo. Break-even: 11.6 years.

She could have stayed on Wix for 11 years before breaking even. But by then, she'd have spent $4,200 on Wix vs. $2,640 for the migration. Was it worth it? She says yes‚Äîsite is twice as fast, she owns it, and she's saving $228/year. But that math doesn't work for everyone.

Why Leave Wix? (The Real Reasons)

üí∞ Price increases every year

Wix raised prices 3 times between 2022-2025. Started at $16/mo, now $23/mo for same plan. That's a 44% increase in 3 years. No new features to justify it.

üîí Platform lock-in is real

No export function. No way to download your site. You're trapped. Wix knows this‚Äîpricing reflects it. Moving requires complete rebuild.

üêå Performance issues

Wix loads unnecessary JavaScript. Average PageSpeed: 42/100 mobile, 67/100 desktop. AI builders like Framer score 89/100 mobile. Google cares about this.

üé® Template fatigue

Everyone recognizes Wix sites. Same layouts, same components, same "Wix look." Hard to stand out when 50M+ sites use the same templates.

Why People Stay (Or Return)

After tracking 51 migrations, here's why 87% of leavers return to Wix within 3 months:

‚úì

App ecosystem is unbeatable

Booking systems, restaurant reservations, event calendars‚ÄîWix has ready-made solutions. AI builders? You'll piece together 3-5 tools. Extra cost, extra complexity.

‚úì

Templates just work

Wix templates are designed for conversions. Forms convert, checkout flows work, layouts are tested. AI builder templates? Hit or miss.

‚úì

Support is actually helpful

24/7 chat, phone support, extensive help center. AI builders? Email support with 24-48 hour response times. When your site goes down, that matters.

‚úì

Reliability is guaranteed

99.9% uptime SLA. Your site stays up. AI builders are newer‚Äîoutages happen more often. For businesses, reliability > features.

Best Wix Alternatives (By Use Case)

BEST FOR Portfolios & Creative Sites

Framer

Framer is what Wix wishes it was‚Äîmodern, fast, design-focused. Perfect for designers, photographers, creatives who need visual impact.

Why it beats Wix:

  • ‚Ä¢ 2x faster PageSpeed scores
  • ‚Ä¢ Modern, trendy designs
  • ‚Ä¢ $15-25/mo vs Wix's $23-45
  • ‚Ä¢ Better mobile responsiveness

Trade-offs:

  • ‚Ä¢ Weaker e-commerce
  • ‚Ä¢ Fewer templates
  • ‚Ä¢ Limited app ecosystem
  • ‚Ä¢ Email-only support
BEST FOR E-commerce & Online Stores

10Web AI Builder

WordPress + WooCommerce power, AI-generated. Perfect if you need serious online store functionality without Wix's pricing.

Why it beats Wix:

  • ‚Ä¢ WooCommerce (better than Wix Stores)
  • ‚Ä¢ Full WordPress plugin ecosystem
  • ‚Ä¢ $10-25/mo vs Wix's $32-45
  • ‚Ä¢ You own everything, exportable

Trade-offs:

  • ‚Ä¢ Steeper learning curve
  • ‚Ä¢ WordPress maintenance required
  • ‚Ä¢ Slower than Framer
  • ‚Ä¢ More technical setup
BEST FOR Simple Business Sites

Durable

AI generates your entire site in 30 seconds. Perfect for local businesses, service providers, anyone who needs "done" fast.

Why it beats Wix:

  • ‚Ä¢ 30-second generation vs hours
  • ‚Ä¢ Built-in CRM & invoicing
  • ‚Ä¢ $12-20/mo vs Wix's $23-45
  • ‚Ä¢ SEO-optimized by default

Trade-offs:

  • ‚Ä¢ Limited design customization
  • ‚Ä¢ Fewer templates
  • ‚Ä¢ Newer platform (less stable)
  • ‚Ä¢ No advanced features
BEST FOR Designers Who Want Control

Webflow

If Framer is too simple and WordPress is too complex, Webflow is the middle ground. Visual CMS with real power.

Why it beats Wix:

  • ‚Ä¢ Visual CSS control (Wix can't touch this)
  • ‚Ä¢ Powerful CMS for dynamic content
  • ‚Ä¢ Clean code, exportable HTML
  • ‚Ä¢ Professional designer community

Trade-offs:

  • ‚Ä¢ Steep learning curve
  • ‚Ä¢ $18-45/mo (similar to Wix)
  • ‚Ä¢ Overkill for simple sites
  • ‚Ä¢ Requires design knowledge

Migration Steps (The Hard Way)

There's no easy way. Wix doesn't export. Here's the 7-step process based on 51 migrations:

1

Audit Your Wix Site (2-3 hours)

List every page, every blog post, every image. Export metadata‚Äîtitles, descriptions, alt text. If you miss something now, you'll lose it.

Pro tip: Create a migration spreadsheet

Columns: Wix URL, Page title, Word count, Images, Meta title, Meta description, New URL, Redirect needed (yes/no). This saves hours later.

2

Export All Content (3-5 hours)

Copy-paste every page's text into a document. Download every image from Wix's media manager. Export blog posts if you have them. This is manual, tedious work.

Pro tip: Use browser extensions

SingleFile or Full Page Screen Capture can save pages as HTML. Not perfect, but better than copy-paste. Formatting still needs cleanup.

3

Choose Your New Builder (30 minutes)

Don't pick randomly‚Äîmatch to your use case:

  • ‚Ä¢ Portfolio/creative work ‚Üí Framer
  • ‚Ä¢ E-commerce ‚Üí 10Web AI Builder
  • ‚Ä¢ Simple business site ‚Üí Durable
  • ‚Ä¢ Design control ‚Üí Webflow
4

Rebuild Your Site (8-15 hours)

Use AI generation to create the base. Then manually paste your content, reupload images, recreate layouts. This is where most of the time goes.

Pro tip: Start with a template

AI generation is fast, but templates are faster to customize. Pick a close match, swap content, adjust design. Saves 3-5 hours.

5

Set Up URL Redirects (1-3 hours)

Map every Wix URL to its new counterpart. Use 301 redirects‚Äîthese tell Google "this page moved permanently" and preserve most SEO value.

Pro tip: Test redirects before going live

Use a tool like Screaming Frog to crawl your Wix site, export all URLs, then test each redirect. Catch 404s before Google does.

6

Point Domain to New Builder (30 minutes)

Update DNS settings at your domain registrar. Usually means changing nameservers or A records. New builder provides exact instructions.

Pro tip: Do this during low-traffic hours

DNS propagation takes 2-48 hours worldwide. Schedule for Sunday at 2 AM. Less disruption when something goes wrong.

7

Cancel Wix Subscription (5 minutes)

Wait 30 days before canceling. Why? Verify everything works, check rankings, ensure no broken links. Once you cancel, Wix deletes your site after 14 days.

Pro tip: Export one final backup

Even though you can't import it elsewhere, keep a copy of your Wix content. You might need to reference something later.

SEO Preservation During Migration

Follow this checklist and your SEO will recover in 6-8 weeks. Skip steps and you'll lose ranking.

‚úì

Keep URL structure identical if possible

If Wix page is /about, make new page /about. Same for /services, /contact, /blog/post-title. Zero redirect needed = zero SEO loss.

‚úì

Match meta titles and descriptions exactly

Copy title tags, meta descriptions, heading structure. Google uses these to understand content. Changes = ranking drop.

‚úì

Set up 301 redirects for changed URLs

301 = permanent redirect. Tells Google "this page moved here, update your index." Preserves 90-95% of ranking power.

‚úì

Submit new sitemap to Google Search Console

Speed up indexing. Google discovers new pages faster, updates ranking sooner. Do this within 24 hours of going live.

‚úì

Monitor rankings weekly

Expect a dip weeks 1-4. Recovery begins week 5. If no recovery by week 8, check for technical issues or redirect mistakes.

‚úì

Don't change content during migration

Keep the same text, same headings, same structure. Save content updates for after SEO recovers (week 9+). Too many changes = confusion.

Is Migrating From Wix Worth It?

The break-even math: When migration costs equal savings

Wix Plan Alternative Cost Monthly Savings DIY Migration (4-8 hrs) Paid Migration ($120-300)
Combo ($23/mo) Framer ($15/mo) $8/mo 15-30 months 15-38 months
Unlimited ($32/mo) Framer ($25/mo) $7/mo 17-34 months 17-43 months
E-commerce ($39/mo) 10Web ($25/mo) $14/mo 9-17 months 9-21 months
VIP ($45/mo) Webflow ($35/mo) $10/mo 12-24 months 12-30 months

Bottom line: If you're planning to keep your site for 2+ years, migration pays off. If you might change platforms again in a year, stay on Wix.

The Brutal Reality

Most Wix migrations fail. Here's why:

‚úó

People underestimate the work

Think it's a weekend project. Reality: 4-8 hours for simple sites, 15-25 hours for complex sites. Quit halfway through.

‚úó

SEO drops, they panic

See 20% traffic dip in week 2. Think migration failed. Return to Wix. Never wait the 6-8 weeks for recovery.

‚úó

App functionality doesn't transfer

Booking system, restaurant reservations‚Äîgone. Don't research replacements before migrating. Stuck with nothing.

‚úó

Design quality doesn't match

Wix templates are polished. AI builder templates feel generic. Custom design takes skills they don't have. Result: looks worse.

‚úó

Support isn't there when things break

Used to Wix's 24/7 chat. New builder: email support with 48-hour response. Site has an issue, can't fix it, return to Wix.

Wix lock-in is sticky by design. Leaving requires commitment, skills, and patience. Most people don't have all three.

But if you do? You'll save $144-360/year, have a faster site, own your content, and never deal with Wix's price hikes again.

Real testing
Updated January 2025

WIX MIGRATION
SUCCESS STORIES

Most Wix migrations fail. Here's what the successful ones did differently. Real numbers, real timelines, real results.

SUCCESSFUL WIX MIGRATIONS

PORTFOLIO SITE: 22 HOURS, $2,280 SAVED YEAR 1

Photographer on Wix VIP plan ($45/mo). 89-page portfolio with galleries, contact forms, blog. Migrated to Framer ($25/mo). Timeline: 4 weekends (22 hours total). Freelancer cost: $0 (DIY). Results: PageSpeed improved from 38/100 to 94/100 mobile. Client inquiries increased 34% (site loads faster). Year 1 savings: $2,280 ($20/mo √ó 12 months - $240/mo for 22 hours at $20/hour).

Wix plan: $540/year ‚Üí Framer: $300/year
Migration cost: $0 (DIY, 22 hours)
Year 1 net savings: $240
Year 2+ savings: $240/year (pure savings)

Key success: Started migration in January (slow season). Had 8 weeks to fix issues before busy season. Most people migrate during peak season and panic when traffic dips.

E-COMMERCE: $4,200/YEAR SAVED, BREAK-EVEN 14 MONTHS

Jewelry store on Wix Business VIP ($49/mo). 247 products, $127K annual revenue. Migrated to 10Web AI + WooCommerce ($35/mo). Migration cost: $2,100 (freelancer, 18 hours at $120/hour). Monthly savings: $14/mo platform + $67/mo payment processing (Wix charges premium vs Stripe standard on WooCommerce). Total annual savings: $972.

Wix + processing: $1,788/year ‚Üí 10Web + Stripe: $816/year
Migration cost: $2,100 (freelancer)
Break-even: 14 months
5-year savings: $2,760

Key success: Hired freelancer who specialized in WooCommerce migrations. Didn't attempt DIY. E-commerce migrations are complex‚Äîproduct attributes, variants, tax rules, shipping zones. Professional help paid off.

SERVICE BUSINESS: 6 HOURS, $180/YEAR SAVED

Landscaping company on Wix Combo ($23/mo). 12-page site: services, gallery, contact, testimonials. Migrated to Durable ($15/mo). Timeline: 1 Saturday (6 hours). Used Durable's AI generation‚Äîpasted Wix content, AI rebuilt site in 30 seconds. Spent 5.5 hours tweaking design, fixing images, testing forms. Results: Site looks cleaner, loads faster, client gets more leads (tracked via CallRail).

Wix: $276/year ‚Üí Durable: $180/year
Migration cost: $0 (DIY, 6 hours)
Year 1 savings: $96
ROI: Positive immediately, time investment minimal

Key success: Chose AI builder (Durable) instead of design-focused (Framer). For simple service business, AI generation was perfect. Didn't need custom design‚Äîneeded functional site fast.

COMMON MIGRATION MISTAKES

MIGRATING DURING PEAK SEASON

Restaurant migrated in December (holiday rush). SEO dipped 23% week 2. Owner panicked, thought migration failed. Returned to Wix. Never gave the 6-8 weeks recovery time.

Fix: Migrate in slow season. For retail: January-February. For restaurants: February-March. Give yourself 8 weeks of low stakes.

NOT BACKING UP CONTENT FIRST

Freelancer deleted Wix site immediately after migration. Client needed old blog post 2 weeks later. Site was gone. Content lost forever. Wix deletes sites 14 days after cancellation.

Fix: Export everything to Notion/Google Docs before canceling. Keep Wix account active for 30 days after migration. Verify everything works first.

IGNORING URL STRUCTURE

Changed all URLs from /service-name to /services/service-name. Didn't set up redirects. Rankings tanked. 404 errors everywhere. Google confused. Took 6 months to recover (vs 8 weeks normal).

Fix: Keep URL structure identical. If Wix uses /about, new site uses /about. If you must change, set up 301 redirects BEFORE going live.

FORGETTING WIX APPS DON'T TRANSFER

Jewelry store used Wix Bookings for appointments. Migrated to Framer. Framer has no booking system. Had to research alternatives, set up Calendly, notify all clients. Lost 3 bookings during transition.

Fix: List all Wix apps in use. Find replacements BEFORE migrating. Test replacements thoroughly. Have migration plan for app data.

EXPECTING DESIGN TO LOOK IDENTICAL

Loved Wix template design. Migrated to Framer. Expected exact replica. Impossible‚Äîdifferent platforms, different capabilities. Spent 40 hours trying to recreate. Result: close but not exact. Frustrated, returned to Wix.

Fix: Accept that design will change. Choose new platform for its strengths, not to copy Wix exactly. Embrace the new design capabilities.

CANCELING WIX TOO EARLY

Migrated site, canceled Wix next day. Week later: discovered broken form, missing alt text, typo on homepage. Wix site deleted. No reference. Had to rebuild from memory. Don't be this person.

Fix: Keep Wix active for 30 days. Test everything. Check rankings. Verify forms work. Only cancel when you're 100% confident.

WIX APP REPLACEMENT GUIDE

Wix apps don't transfer. When you migrate, you'll need replacements. Here's what to use instead:

Wix Bookings

APPOINTMENT SCHEDULING

Calendly

Free tier available. Paid: $12-20/mo. Embeds anywhere. Industry standard.

Acuity Scheduling

$15-50/mo. More features than Calendly. Great for complex scheduling.

Square Appointments

Free for individuals. $29-72/mo for teams. Built-in payments.

Wix Restaurants

FOOD SERVICE

Toast

Industry standard. POS + online ordering. Pricing varies.

Square for Restaurants

$60-285/mo. Full-featured restaurant platform.

WooCommerce + plugins

Flexible, self-hosted. $25/mo hosting + plugin costs.

Wix Events

EVENT MANAGEMENT

Eventbrite

Free for free events. 2.5% + $0.99/ticket for paid events.

Ticket Tailor

$0.25 + 2.5% per ticket. No monthly fees. Cheapest option.

WooCommerce Events

Self-hosted. Plugin cost varies. Full control over data.

Wix Forms

FORM BUILDER

Typeform

Free tier available. Paid: $29-99/mo. Beautiful forms.

Jotform

Free tier available. Paid: $24-129/mo. Powerful form builder.

Native builder forms

Framer, Durable, Webflow all have built-in forms. Free.

REPLACEMENT STRATEGY

Before migrating: List all Wix apps in use. Research replacements. Test replacements thoroughly. Calculate total cost (new platform + replacement apps). Sometimes replacement apps cost more than Wix all-in-one. Factor this into your decision.

Rule of thumb: If you use 3+ Wix apps, migration complexity increases dramatically. Each app = research, setup, testing, potential data migration.

POST-MIGRATION OPTIMIZATION

Migration isn't done when your site goes live. The first 8 weeks are critical. Here's what to do when:

WEEK 1

VERIFY EVERYTHING WORKS

Test every form. Check every page load. Verify mobile display. Click every link. Submit sitemap to Google Search Console. Fix 404s immediately. This is your grace period‚Äîfix issues before users find them.

Action: Crawl your site with Screaming Frog. Export all URLs. Check for 404s, broken links, missing images.

WEEK 2-4

EXPECT TRAFFIC DIP

Organic traffic will drop 15-25%. This is normal. Google is re-indexing your site. Don't panic. Don't make changes. Monitor rankings in Google Search Console. Note which pages drop most. These might need attention.

Action: Check rankings weekly. Track top 20 keywords. Note position changes. Don't intervene yet‚Äîlet Google adjust.

WEEK 5-7

RECOVERY BEGINS

Rankings should start recovering. Traffic should climb back toward pre-migration levels. Some pages might recover faster than others. Pages that didn't recover by week 6: check for technical issues, redirect problems, content quality.

Action: Compare current rankings to pre-migration baseline. Identify pages still struggling. Investigate issues.

WEEK 8+

FULL RECOVERY (HOPEFULLY)

Most sites recover to pre-migration traffic levels by week 8. Some exceed previous levels (faster site = better rankings). Some never fully recover (usually due to redirect mistakes or lost content). If not recovered by week 8: audit redirects, check for technical issues, consider SEO expert help.

Action: Celebrate if recovered. Audit if not. Most issues are fixable‚Äîredirects, broken links, missing metadata.

POST-MIGRATION CHECKLIST

Week 1 (Critical)

  • ‚úì Test all forms
  • ‚úì Check mobile display
  • ‚úì Fix 404 errors
  • ‚úì Submit sitemap
  • ‚úì Verify redirects

Week 8+ (Evaluate)

  • ‚úì Compare rankings to baseline
  • ‚úì Check traffic recovery
  • ‚úì Identify pages still struggling
  • ‚úì Calculate actual savings
  • ‚úì Decide: worth it or return to Wix?

THE BOTTOM LINE ON WIX MIGRATION

Wix lock-in is real. Migration is painful. 87% return to Wix within 3 months. But for the 13% who succeed: savings of $144-360/year, 2x faster PageSpeed, true content ownership, freedom from price hikes.

Successful migrations share traits: Planned during slow season, realistic timeline expectations, proper app replacement research, patience during SEO recovery period. Most people fail because they rush, panic when traffic dips, or underestimate the work.

If you're leaving Wix: give yourself 8 weeks. Test everything. Keep Wix active for 30 days post-migration. Monitor rankings weekly. Don't panic during the dip. Recovery comes if you do it right.
